wikipedia_page.main: Barry Cowan (born 25 August 1974) is a British former tennis player, best known for taking Pete Sampras to five sets at Wimbledon in 2001.

response: | 2001 ||  Byron Black Wayne Black ||  Barry Cowan Mosé Navarra || 6–3, 6–4

In March 1998 he and Lior Mor won in Israel, defeating Barry Cowan and Filippo Veglio 6–4, 7–6  in the final. In June he and partner Raviv Weidenfeld won in Ireland, defeating Daniele Braccoalo and Igor Gaudi 7–6, 6–4 in the final.  In July he and Mor won in Greece, defeating Gilles Elseneer and Wim Neefs 6–3, 0–6, 6–3 in the final.
* Barry Cowan, tennis player, former member of Aughton Tennis Club
:This page is on the Irish broadcast journalist.  For the former English tennis player see Barry Cowan (tennis).

Barry Cowan (1 February 1948 – 16 June 2004) was a high-profile journalist and broadcaster with BBC Northern Ireland.https://www.theguardian.com/media/2004/jun/22/northernireland.broadcasting In 1974, he became the anchor of BBC Northern Ireland's flagship evening television news programme Scene Around Six, which established him as a household name in Northern Ireland.  This involved bringing the news into people's homes during some of the worst years of the Northern Irish Troubles.
